Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, interior very worn, exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip and faint traces of two lines of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as from the estate of Amenhotep III.
Curator's comments: Peet & Woolley, City of Akhenaten I. Pl. LXIV fig. 23
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393178) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393178)
